titleStmt.title: A Digital Transcription of Denslow's ABC book

sourceDesc.ab:
Title: Denslow's ABC book.
Author/Artist: Denslow, W. W. (William Wallace), 1856-1915.
Published/Created: New York : G.W. Dillingham Co., 1903 New York : J.J. Little & Co.
General: [12] p. : col. ill. ; 29 cm.
Series: Denslow's picture books for children
Notes: Wrapper title.
"Published August 1903"--Copyright page.
"To Mira Bowles"--Copyright page.
"For these books, W. W. Denslow has revised and adapted several of the best classical fairy tales. He has improved these stories by elimination of all coarseness, cruelty, and everything that might frighten children. They are new; more beautiful and striking in both text and picture than any children's books heretofore published. Each book is filled with pictures of action and fun in brilliant colors. The twelve books are uniform in size"--Rear wrapper.
In verse.
Cover p. 2 and 3 are white with color-printed pictures.
Relief illustrations, color printed; figures depicted include the Scarecrow and Tin Man characters from L. Frank Baum's Oz books; first printing as described in Greene & Hearn below.
CTSN copy: Inscribed verso f. cover "To / Edward Holbrook / From / Mualmu Jenckes / Oct. 3, 1906.".
Binding Note: Pub. white col. pictorial. self wrappers with advertisement on rear.
References: Greene & Hearn. W. W. Denslow, 29K
Subject(s): English language -- Alphabet -- Juvenile poetry ; Alphabet -- Juvenile poetry ; Alphabet books -- Specimens
